item.title: By: BjÃ¸rn Andersen
item.dc:creator: BjÃ¸rn Andersen
item.description:
Btw - seems to be an error in your script: Msg 102, Level 15, State 1, Line 4 Incorrect syntax near '0x00'.
Changing (sid is not null and sid 0Ã—0) to (sid is not null and sid = 0Ã—0) did the trick.
Just saying :-)
item.content:encoded:
Btw – seems to be an error in your script:
Msg 102, Level 15, State 1, Line 4
Incorrect syntax near ‘0x00’.

Changing (sid is not null and sid 0Ã—0) to (sid is not null and sid = 0Ã—0) did the trick.

Just saying ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Tri Effendi Saputro
item.dc:creator: Tri Effendi Saputro
item.description: And the replacement for "finding" the orphaned users instead of using "EXECUTE sp_change_users_login â€˜reportâ€™", just use this query: <STRONG> USE [theDatabase] GO SELECT OrphanedUser = name, UserSID = sid FROM sysusers WHERE issqluser = 1 and (sid is not null and sid 0x0) and (len(sid) <= 16) and suser_sname(sid) is null ORDER BY name </STRONG>
item.content:encoded:
And the replacement for “finding” the orphaned users instead of using “EXECUTE sp_change_users_login â€˜reportâ€™”, just use this query:

USE [theDatabase]
GO
SELECT OrphanedUser = name, UserSID = sid
FROM sysusers
WHERE issqluser = 1
and (sid is not null and sid 0x0)
and (len(sid) <= 16)
and suser_sname(sid) is null
ORDER BY name

item.title: By: Luis Azario

item.description:
What if I need to change a Windows integrated user from one domain to another. For example I have login:
DOMAINONE\USERCARLOS AND NEED TO DELETE it and create a new login NEWDOMAIN\USERCARLOS BUT

item.title: By: sqlQuestion
item.dc:creator: sqlQuestion
item.description: that's great...but what is the replacement for "finding" the orphaned users? <br /> Instead of "EXECUTE sp_change_users_login 'report'"?
item.content:encoded:
that’s great…but what is the replacement for “finding” the orphaned users?
Instead of “EXECUTE sp_change_users_login ‘report'”?
